question: With reference to the India Justice Report 2024-25, consider the following statements:
statements: The report highlights understaffing and gender imbalance in the police and judiciary.
Only Karnataka meets the SC/ST/OBC quota representation in the judiciary.
Prisons in India have an average occupancy rate of 100%.
explanation: The India Justice Report highlights systemic gaps such as **23% vacancy in police**, **8% women in senior ranks**, and **low judge-to-population ratio**. Karnataka is the **only state** fulfilling judicial diversity quotas. **Prisons are overcrowded at 131% occupancy**, not 100%. [India Justice Report](https://www.tatatrusts.org/our-work/initiatives/india-justice-report)

question: QpiAI-Indus, recently seen in news, is:
options: India's first supercomputer based on exascale architecture
An AI-based diagnosis platform for tuberculosis
A quantum communication satellite launched by ISRO
explanation: QpiAI-Indus is India’s **first full-stack 25-qubit superconducting quantum computer**, launched under the National Quantum Mission. It integrates quantum hardware, software, and control systems. [National Quantum Mission - PIB](https://pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=1916631)

question: Consider the following principles related to quantum computing:
statements: Superposition enables qubits to exist in multiple states simultaneously.
Entanglement refers to linked states between particles regardless of distance.
Interference is used to suppress correct answers and amplify errors.
explanation: **Superposition** and **entanglement** are key to quantum computation. However, **interference** helps **amplify correct outcomes** and suppress errors—not the opposite. [Quantum computing - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_computing)

question: Which organization is the implementing agency for the National Quantum Mission?
explanation: The **Department of Science and Technology (DST)** under the Ministry of Science & Technology is the nodal agency for implementing the **National Quantum Mission** (2023–2031).

question: With reference to the WHO Pandemic Agreement, consider the following provisions:
statements: It promotes a One Health approach acknowledging human-animal-environment interconnection.
It mandates equitable access and benefit-sharing of pathogen-related data.
It removes the obligation for member states to follow the International Health Regulations (IHR).
explanation: The WHO Pandemic Treaty supports **One Health**, promotes **benefit-sharing of pathogens**, and **does not override** existing IHR commitments. IHR (2005) remains a binding international instrument. [WHO Pandemic Agreement](https://www.who.int/news/item/28-02-2024-pandemic-agreement-negotiations)

question: Which of the following is a key direction issued by the Supreme Court in the Pinki v. State of Uttar Pradesh case regarding child trafficking?
options: Establish a central registry for traffickers
Mandate DNA tests for all rescued children
explanation: The Supreme Court directed **High Courts to finish child trafficking trials within 6 months**. It also ordered reporting improvements and strengthened institutional frameworks for protection. [SC guidelines - The Hindu](https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/sc-issues-guidelines-to-combat-child-trafficking/article68000763.ece)

question: Which of the following measures has India adopted to reduce its dependence on China for Rare Earth Elements (REEs)?
statements: Amending mining laws to boost private participation
Collaborating with the US under the TRUST initiative
Importing REEs from African countries under Free Trade Agreements
explanation: India has amended mining laws and launched the **TRUST initiative** with the US. While REE import diversification is a goal, FTAs with African nations specifically for REEs have not been reported. [Rare Earth Elements - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rare-earth_element)

question: What is the Long Period Average (LPA) of southwest monsoon rainfall in India (1971–2020)?
explanation: **LPA** is calculated over a long period and used as a reference for forecasting. The current LPA for **southwest monsoon (1971–2020)** is **87 cm**. [IMD LPA](https://mausam.imd.gov.in/imd_latest/contents/lpa_rainfall.php)

question: rt-LAMP method, recently tested for TB diagnosis, is different from RT-PCR in which of the following ways?
statements: It is an open platform technology using six primers.
It can give positive results within 10–20 minutes.
It requires more expensive infrastructure than RT-PCR.
explanation: **rt-LAMP** uses **six primers** and works faster than RT-PCR, providing results in **10–20 minutes**. It is also more **cost-effective**, not more expensive. [LAMP - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loop-mediated_isothermal_amplification)

question: Which military exercise is conducted annually between India and Uzbekistan?
explanation: **Exercise Dustlik** is a bilateral military exercise between **India and Uzbekistan**, conducted alternately in both countries to improve cooperation. [Exercise Dustlik - PIB](https://pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=1808013)

question: With reference to Surat Emission Trading Scheme (ETS), consider the following statements:
statements: It is the world’s first market for trading in particulate matter emissions.
Industries can sell unused permits if they emit below their cap.
The trading platform is managed by SEBI.
explanation: Launched in 2019, **Surat ETS** is the **first-ever particulate matter trading scheme** in the world. It uses a **cap-and-trade model** and permits are traded on a platform run by **NeML (NCDEX e-Markets)**, not SEBI. [Emission Trading Scheme - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emissions_trading)

question: What is a 'Digital Arrest'?
options: An AI-driven facial recognition surveillance tool
A legal action where biometric data is mandatorily recorded
A cyber scam where fake law enforcement demands money or data
correct_option: A cyber scam where fake law enforcement demands money or data
explanation: **Digital Arrest** is a cybercrime where fraudsters impersonate police or CBI via video/audio calls to **extort money or data**. It's addressed under CBI's **Operation Chakra-V**. [Digital Arrest - CERT-In](https://www.cert-in.org.in/)

question: Which of the following statements about Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are correct?
statements: TPUs are designed specifically for deep learning and AI tasks.
They can perform parallel processing faster than traditional CPUs.
TPUs were first launched by Google in 2021.
explanation: **TPUs** are AI-optimized chips developed by Google since **2015**, excelling at **tensor operations** and **parallel processing**—unlike CPUs. The latest is the **7th-gen Ironwood**. [TPU - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensor_processing_unit)

question: Which regulatory framework is associated with the Countercyclical Capital Buffer (CCyB)?
explanation: **CCyB** is a tool under **Basel III norms**, enabling central banks to ask banks to hold **extra capital in good times** to buffer downturns. RBI introduced it in **2015**, but hasn’t yet activated it. [Basel III - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basel_III)

question: With reference to the Open Acreage Licensing Policy (OALP), consider the following statements:
statements: It is implemented under the Hydrocarbon Exploration and Licensing Policy (HELP).
It replaced the New Exploration Licensing Policy (NELP).
Blocks are allocated only by the government, based on revenue-sharing contracts.
explanation: **OALP**, introduced under **HELP in 2016**, replaced **NELP**. It enables investors to propose blocks using data from the **National Data Repository**. The blocks are not allocated solely by the government. [OALP - PIB](https://pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=1776910)

question: Which of the following statements are correct about Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)?
statements: It was established in 1875 as 'The Native Share & Stock Brokers' Association'.
It is regulated by SEBI under the SEBI Act, 1992.
It became the first listed stock exchange of India in 2020.
explanation: **BSE** is Asia’s oldest stock exchange, established in **1875**. It was listed on the NSE in **2017**, not 2020. It is regulated under the **SEBI Act, 1992**. [BSE - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombay_Stock_Exchange)

question: Which of the following are examples of Rare Earth Elements (REEs)?
explanation: **REEs** are a set of **17 metallic elements**, critical in defense, electronics, and green tech. Examples include **Cerium, Europium, Yttrium**, Dysprosium, etc. [REEs - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rare-earth_element)

question: Which of the following countries has the largest reserves of Rare Earth Elements (REEs)?
explanation: **China** leads in REE **reserves (44 million tonnes)** and controls **85% of global supply**. India has about **6.9 MT reserves** but limited processing capacity. [REE supply chain - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rare-earth_element)

question: What is the primary role of the National Data Repository (NDR) in OALP?
options: Monitoring environmental compliance in oil blocks
Facilitating exploration by storing sedimentary basin data
Determining fiscal incentives for oil producers
correct_option: Facilitating exploration by storing sedimentary basin data
explanation: **NDR** is a centralized digital platform containing **E&P (Exploration & Production) data** for India’s sedimentary basins. It supports investors in OALP. [NDR - DGH India](https://www.dghindia.gov.in/index.php/page?pageId=20&name=National_Data_Repository)

question: Which country is India collaborating with under the TRUST initiative to ensure secure access to Rare Earth Elements?
explanation: **India and the US** launched the **TRUST initiative** in Feb 2025 under the **Minerals Security Partnership**, to enhance cooperation on REE access and tech transfer. [US-India Minerals Security Partnership](https://www.state.gov/minerals-security-partnership/)

question: With reference to child trafficking in India, consider the following statements:
statements: Article 23 of the Constitution prohibits trafficking in human beings.
The PENCIL portal is used to report and monitor child trafficking cases.
The Juvenile Justice Act, 2015 provides legal safeguards for trafficked children.
explanation: **Article 23** of the Constitution prohibits human trafficking. **PENCIL** (Platform for Effective Enforcement for No Child Labour) ensures enforcement of related laws. The **Juvenile Justice Act, 2015** protects trafficked and vulnerable children. [Wikipedia – Human trafficking in India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_trafficking_in_India)

question: What is the objective of the WHO Pathogen Access and Benefit-Sharing System?
options: To develop a centralized vaccine repository
To promote genome editing of viruses
To ensure equitable access to pathogen samples and benefits arising from them
To ban research on pandemic-causing pathogens
correct_option: To ensure equitable access to pathogen samples and benefits arising from them
explanation: The **WHO Pathogen Access and Benefit-Sharing (PABS)** System promotes **transparent sharing** of pathogen samples and benefits like **vaccines and diagnostics**, especially for **developing nations**. [WHO – Pandemic Agreement](https://www.who.int/initiatives/defeating-meningitis-by-2030)

question: With reference to the International Health Regulations (IHR), consider the following:
statements: They were adopted in 1969 and initially covered only six diseases.
The IHR is legally binding on all WHO member states.
They apply only to biological hazards, not chemical or radiological ones.
explanation: **IHR (2005)** initially covered six diseases in 1969, later expanded to **biological, chemical, and radiological threats**. It is legally binding on **all 194 WHO members + Liechtenstein and Holy See**. [IHR - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Health_Regulations)

question: Which of the following factors are major drivers of child trafficking in India?
statements: Poverty and child marriages
Disaster-induced displacement
Over-regulation of small industries
explanation: **Poverty**, **child marriage**, and **displacement from disasters** are major causes of child trafficking. Over-regulation may affect industries but isn't directly linked to trafficking. [NCRB data – Child trafficking](https://ncrb.gov.in/)

question: Operation Chakra-V, launched by the CBI, primarily targets:
options: Digital impersonation scams and financial frauds
correct_option: Digital impersonation scams and financial frauds
explanation: **Operation Chakra-V** focuses on **cybercrime networks**, especially **'digital arrests'**, involving fake law enforcement scams and international cyber frauds. [CBI press release](https://cbi.gov.in/)

question: Which of the following organizations is responsible for the Emission Trading Scheme (ETS) platform in Surat?
explanation: **NeML** operates the **Surat ETS** platform where industries trade emission permits under India’s first **particulate matter trading scheme**. [Surat ETS - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emissions_trading)

question: India and the United States signed the TRUST initiative for cooperation in which of the following areas?
explanation: The **TRUST initiative** was launched by **India and the US** in 2025 to improve cooperation on **REE supply chains**, expanding on the earlier **Minerals Security Partnership**. [Rare Earth - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rare-earth_element)

question: Which of the following is the correct match of military exercises and participating nations?
explanation: **Nomadic Elephant** is a joint exercise between **India and Mongolia**, focusing on counterinsurgency and mountain warfare. [List of Indian Military Exercises](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_joint_military_exercises_of_India)

question: Which country recently completed 150 years of its stock exchange, the oldest in Asia?
explanation: India's **Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)** was founded in **1875** and is the **oldest stock exchange in Asia**. It celebrated its **150th year** in 2025. [BSE – Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombay_Stock_Exchange)

question: What is the significance of superposition in quantum computing?
options: It allows quantum computers to operate without electricity
It enables a qubit to exist in both 0 and 1 states simultaneously
correct_option: It enables a qubit to exist in both 0 and 1 states simultaneously
explanation: **Superposition** allows a **qubit** to exist in **multiple states (0 and 1)** at once, enabling **parallel computation**. This is key to the **power of quantum computing**. [Quantum Computing - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_computing)
